column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline samples of K2Ni2TeO6 were synthesized
#Text=through the conventional high-temperature solid-state ceramics route (details provided in the Experimental Section).
#Text=The composition of the as-prepared material was ascertained
#Text=using inductively coupled plasma-atomic emission spectroscopy (Table S1), whereas the uniformity of the constituent
#Text=elements and morphology were validated using scanning
#Text=electron microscopy (shown in Figure S1).
#Text=The obtained
#Text=powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) pattern of as-prepared
#Text=K2Ni2TeO6 (Figure S2 and Table S2) could be indexed to
#Text=the hexagonal lattice adopting the P2-type framework.7
#Text=K2Ni2TeO6 displays a layered crystal structure comprising K
#Text=atoms coordinated with oxygen atoms interposed between
#Text=slabs of NiO6 and TeO6 as illustrated by Figure 1a.
#Text=The NiO6
#Text=slab is composed of divalent nickel atoms (as affirmed by X-ray
#Text=absorption spectroscopy (Figure S3)) coordinated to six
#Text=oxygen atoms, whereas the TeO6 contains Te atoms also
#Text=coordinated to six oxygen atoms.
#Text=As shown in Figure 1b, a
#Text=honeycomb configuration of NiO6 and TeO6 octahedra is
#Text=formed with each TeO6 surrounded by six NiO6 octahedra.
#Text=In
#Text=each unit cell, there are two repetitive layers of NiO6 and TeO6
#Text=octahedra that are separated by K atoms in a prismatic
#Text=coordination with adjacent oxygen atoms.
#Text=Even though humps
#Text=indicating the presence of defects were detected (Figure S2),
#Text=they could not be indexed using XRD, necessitating further
#Text=characterization using TEM.
